text: Shadow Agricultural Minister Joel Fitzgibbon says he wishes “Scott Morrison hadn’t sought to talk-up or exaggerate what the government is doing” to help the drought crisis, because it is now “becoming a food security issue”. Mr Fitzgibbon told Sky News on Wednesday he encourages a “war cabinet” as an initiative to deal with the “national emergency” gripping Australian farmers. “We now know that not one cent of the $5 billion future drought fund will go to farmers”, and Scott Morrison is “being loose with the truth,” he said. The Shadow Agricultural Minister said Labor needs to “put pressure on the government to act,” without being accused of politicising the devastating drought crisis. Image: Getty
